New Records: Anthony Edwards has notched career-highs in three-point attempts and makes per game this season.
Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards led the Timberwolves in a win over the Trail Blazers with 37 points on 12-of-21 shooting, connecting on nine of his 15 3-point attempts.
Pre-Game Insights: Anthony Edwards expressed his frustration with teams not respecting him from 3-point range, stating he will continue to shoot despite their defensive strategies.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards backed up his talk with his performance on Friday, leading the Timberwolves to a 127-102 win over the Trail Blazers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves advanced to 6-3 on the season, while Portland fell to 3-7.
Others: Anthony Edwards is averaging 28.0 points, 5.9 rebounds, and 3.4 assists, shooting 48.2% from the field and an eye-popping 46.1% from 3-point range.
New Player Records: Anthony Edwards' 5.1 three-pointers made per game this season is a significant increase from his previous seasons.
Team Records: The Timberwolves have won three games in a row.
Milestones or Significant Achievements: Anthony Edwards has shown a significant increase in his 3-point volume and is capitalizing on teams failing to close out.
Other: Edwards is answering the questions regarding Minnesota's 3-point shooting with the loss of Karl-Anthony Towns.
